it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller.effects

Class EffectManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller.effects.EffectManager

  • public class EffectManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that provides methods to card effect classes to: - ask players who called the corresponding cards additional information required by the defined rules. - provide methods to do basic changes to the surrounding game context.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EffectManager(EffectContext context)
      Creates a new EffectManager object that will execute effects in the given context.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EffectManager

        public EffectManager(EffectContext context)
        Creates a new EffectManager object that will execute effects in the given context.
        See Also:
        to see how to represent the context the effect should act on.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(Effect effect)
             throws UndoException
        Throws:
        UndoException

      • getActor

        public Player getActor()
        Returns the Player that is using the card associated with the running effects.

      • getAttacker

        public Player getAttacker()
        Returns the Player that attacked the actor, triggering this effect to be called. Note that this method will return null unless the context is a revenge context (e.g. the effect is from a Tagback Grenade power up)

      • getVictim

        public Player getVictim()
        Returns the Player that the actor has attacked, triggering this effect to be called. Note that this method will return null unless the context is a "additional action" context (e.g. the effect is from a Targeting Scope power up)

      • damagePlayer

        public void damagePlayer(Player attacker,
                         Player victim,
                         int damageAmount,
                         int markAmount)
        Registers a the given damage and marks from the attacker to the victim. Note that this may trigger events to ask players for power ups that can be used in particular situations. This will realize any pre-existing marks of victim from attacker
        Parameters:
        attacker - Player dealing damage
        victim - Player receiving damage
        damageAmount - amount of damage dealt
        markAmount - amount of marks dealt

      • damagePlayer

        public void damagePlayer(Player attacker,
                         Player victim,
                         int damageAmount,
                         int markAmount,
                         boolean canRealizeMarks)
        Registers a the given damage and marks from the attacker to the victim. Note that this may trigger events to ask players for power ups that can be used in particular situations.
        Parameters:
        attacker - Player dealing damage
        victim - Player receiving damage
        damageAmount - amount of damage dealt
        markAmount - amount of marks dealt
        canRealizeMarks - can this damage realize previous marks

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(Player player,
                       Tile destination)
        Moves the player to the given tile.

      • reportGameChange

        public void reportGameChange(GameChange gameChange)
        Reports the given game change object, storing it in the list of game changes that should be undo in case of request from the user. Note that this also requests the context to apply the game change to the game.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(MetaPlayer player)
        Returns the player bound to the given meta player, or null if the user has never chosen a player for the given meta player. Note that this methods will never ask the user for a player.

      • bindPlayer

        public Player bindPlayer(MetaPlayer player,
                         PlayerSelector selector)
                  throws UndoException
        Returns the player bound to the given meta player by the user. If the meta player has not been bound yet, a player to bind will be asked to the user.
        Parameters:
        selector - A PlayerSelector object that will filter selectable players.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • bindPlayer

        public Player bindPlayer(MetaPlayer player,
                         PlayerSelector selector,
                         boolean forceChoice)
                  throws UndoException
        Returns the player bound to the given meta player by the user. If the meta player has not been bound yet, a player to bind will be asked to the user.
        Parameters:
        selector - A PlayerSelector object that will filter selectable players.
        forceChoice - whether the user can decide not to choose anyone or be forced to make a choice.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • bindTile

        public Tile bindTile(TileSelector selector)
              throws UndoException
        Asks the user to select a tile.
        Parameters:
        selector - A TileSelector object that will filter selectable tiles.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • bindTile

        public Tile bindTile(TileSelector selector,
                     boolean forceChoice)
              throws UndoException
        Asks the user to select a tile.
        Parameters:
        selector - A TileSelector object that will filter selectable tiles.
        forceChoice - whether the user can decide not to choose any tile or be forced to make a choice.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • choose

        public java.lang.Integer choose(java.lang.Integer... choices)
                         throws UndoException
        Asks the user to choose among the given choices. Choices are encoded as integers that are defined by each effect.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • choose

        public java.lang.Integer choose(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> choices)
                         throws UndoException
        Asks the user to choose among the given choices. Choices are encoded as integers that are defined by each effect.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo

      • pay

        public boolean pay(java.lang.Integer choice,
                   PaymentInvoice price)
            throws UndoException
        Asks the user to pay the given price and with what they want to pay (e.g. use power ups).
        Parameters:
        choice - An integer describing what the invoice is for.
        Returns:
        Whether the user accepted the payment. If true is returned, then this method will deduct the ammos and/or power ups from the player's inventory.
        Throws:
        UndoException - if the user requested an undo
